item.title: Report E-2024090565
item.description:
Report E-2024090565

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDM experienced a UN1760 GF Clean 1052 release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released. The drum was damaged because of improper securement as the drums were not properly strapped to the pallet and shifted off it. The material impacted an 8' x 8' area of the trailer floor and a 11' x 6' area of the concrete lot below. Absorbents & sodium bicarb were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. The damaged drum was containerized into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All impacted absorbents and debris were placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
